title: What is the best portfolio for a 10 lakh rupees investment with a minimum holding time of 15 years and considering child education as a primary investment purpose? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since it is a one time investment, a combination of equity/debt/gold mutual funds will be ideal. Since the period of investment is long, a major part of this corpus can be in equity mutual funds, about 30 % in debt, and 5–10 % in gold. Equity mutual funds - it is better to stagger the investments rather than one time. It is also important to re-balance this portfolio regularly, to maximize the risk adjusted returns. Suggest that you take professional advice to do the initial portfolio planning. You can msg me too if you need inputs

In my opinion, please consider investing in mutual funds. Yes, investing in mutual funds are subjected to market risk but if stayed invested for more than 10 years then there are good chances of getting better returns though key here is selection and tracking of funds. Say if you invest Rs. 10 lakh and if the fund gives a return of 10% in 15 years then your returns would be close to Rs. 41.77 lakhs. Consider investing in health and term insurance to, if planning to invest in mutual funds. For further discussion, please message me in Quora or through email, id in my profile. Arun
